text: hello everyone and thanks for reading! I'm trying to build a custom HubSpot form, I want to have complete flexibility to structure it the way I want. This is what I've done so far. If anyone has an hint on how to solve this, please let me know <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50366525/my-form-submission-get-blocked-because-the-frame-is-sandboxed-and-the-allow-for>

I never worked with the form in a iframe so can't help there but:

I would suggest as the easiest solution, just deactivate the redirection with the UI in HubSpot. Change the option to display a response after submit so it's easier to manage and you won't need that iframe.

If for some reason you can't change that option then, you can submit the data through the API with AJAX:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
but consider that you will need to manage your own validation etc.
Thanks <@U7ADCU3BM>. Do you perhaps have a working example of a custom form?

I'm trying to capture a hidden field value (a dynamically populated URL) from our HubSpot form on 24 different whitepapers. We only want to use 1 form to capture form data. Although we receive the URL in the submission notification, we're having trouble initiating a workflow where that URL is used as a dynamic field in a template email. However when the template email is populated with the hidden token, the URL variable shows "undefined".  Any ideas on how to get the workflow to capture and push the data to the correct email template?
Maybe I am misunderstanding, but what do you need the workflow for? This value is just being stored on the contact record, right?
<@U98RGFUQZ> we're looking to send follow up emails w/ the download link for the whitepaper they've chosen

Nice to see the new COS Developer Onboarding stuff!
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/onboarding/dashboard>
I just caught “Continuous Integration” in action! <https://spin.d.pr/yfjJWF+> lol
Yeah I passed along feedback. I think some pages launched a bit early. lol
someone needs to learn about the magic of {{year}} XD *sorry HS dev’s we tease we tease*
Anyone able to tell me the BIGGEST difference between LPs and Website pages as it pertains to using 2 subdomains for content?

basically, we have a client that wants to host 2 domains on their Professional account (and can't afford to go enterprise) but it's the same user-base / lists so it doesn't make sense to have multiple portals

I have done that for a client.

The only significant difference is how the analytics works, it’s all stored the same i think but the way it displays it for landing pages is more about driving conversions like a landing page should.

That's what I figured - I have a feeling that if I can't convince them to come up with a generic website page subdomain structure (and use /dynamic-pages) then I'll have to go through with some website/lp setup as described above
analytics properly set up or not :disappointed:
